title: Packet loss only while playing league?
body: Okay, my family has the spectrum buisness package which is 100+ mb/s doan and somewhere like 10 mb/s up. I can pretty much play anything I want online, besides League. Everytime I start a game it feels like every single packet I'm sending gets lost, but I have normal ping. Any suggestions?

replies.body:
>Okay, my family has the spectrum buisness package which is 100+ mb/s doan and somewhere like 10 mb/s up

that's a business package???

I've got the same package, and it's the lowest consumer package you can get now. However, good luck reaching 100mb/s ...it's more like 60 IF YOU ARE LUCKY, most of the time it's around 40....


you should also in addition to what the riot person wrote run something called a tracert from the command line to one of riot's servers just to see how things are being routed.

Though your internet sounds solid, you can still have network issues or instability reaching a specific server.  It could be local or even how your ISP routes to us.  In this case that appears to be to reaching the game server, and likely resulting in possible packet loss. 

Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to get a better overview of what's going on, which should also provide some steps specific to your issue.  Let me know the results!
